_source.text: 68 ' Thou 'st have that horse,' his master said, ' If that one thing thou wilt tell me ; Why that horse is better than any other, I pray thee, Tom Pots, shew thou to me.' 69 ' That horse is old, of stomach bold, And well can he skill of his train ; If I be out of my saddle cast, He '1 either stand still or turn again.' 70 ' Thou 'st have the horse with all my heart.
